title: COFFIN FEEDER (ABORTED, LENG TCH'E, Etc.) Makes Big Trouble In Little China Brutal With Their New Single
description: John Carpenter may not be thrilled.
author: Greg Kennelty
byline: By Greg Kennelty Published 8 hours ago
excerpt: John Carpenter may not be thrilled.
text: Coffin Feeder – the band featuring vocalist Sven de Caluwé (Aborted, Fetal Blood Eagle, ex-Leng Tch'e, etc.), guitarists and vocalists Jeroen Camerlynck (Fleddy Melculy) and Bart Govers (Fleddy Melculy), bassist Jan Hallaert (Leng Tch'e), and drummer Siebe Hermans – is here to make the 1986 flick Big Trouble In Little China plenty brutal with their new single "Porkchop Express". It certainly helps that Julien Truchan of Benighted adds some guest vocals on the track, for extra violence. "Porkchop Express" is a part of Coffin Feeder's very movie-centric new record Big Trouble, due out April 25. Pre-orders are available here and the tracklist is as follows, for all you movie buffs: "There will be Trouble" "Porkchop Express" "If It Bleeds" "The Destroyer" "Love At First Death" "Plain Zero" "OBEY" "Get To The Party" "Let Off Some Steam" "H.I.S.S." "A Good Day To Die" "The Wrong Arm Of The Law" “We’re thrilled to be joining the ranks for Listenable Records for our debut full-length album Big Trouble that will be out somewhere next spring!" said de Caluwé of the album. "Listenable has been the home of many quality acts throughout the years and also marked the beginnings of Aborted so in a way it’s like coming home for that nice sundae to tickle your tonsils. "Get ready for a massive onslaught of blasts and grooves to run you over like a bulldozer. The whole thing has been mixed and mastered by the mighty Dave Otero (Aborted, Archspire, Cattle Decapitation, Shadow of Intent) so you know it’s gonna be finger licking good! Alongside that we have a few other very neat surprises, so stay tuned for more!” Want More Metal? html:
Coffin Feeder – the band featuring vocalist Sven de Caluwé (Aborted, Fetal Blood Eagle, ex-Leng Tch'e, etc.), guitarists and vocalists Jeroen Camerlynck (Fleddy Melculy) and Bart Govers (Fleddy Melculy), bassist Jan Hallaert (Leng Tch'e), and drummer Siebe Hermans – is here to make the 1986 flick Big Trouble In Little China plenty brutal with their new single "Porkchop Express". It certainly helps that Julien Truchan of Benighted adds some guest vocals on the track, for extra violence.

"Porkchop Express" is a part of Coffin Feeder's very movie-centric new record Big Trouble, due out April 25. Pre-orders are available here and the tracklist is as follows, for all you movie buffs:

  1. "There will be Trouble"
  2. "Porkchop Express"
  3. "If It Bleeds"
  4. "The Destroyer"
  5. "Love At First Death"
  6. "Plain Zero"
  7. "OBEY"
  8. "Get To The Party"
  9. "Let Off Some Steam"
  10. "H.I.S.S."
  11. "A Good Day To Die"
  12. "The Wrong Arm Of The Law"

“We’re thrilled to be joining the ranks for Listenable Records for our debut full-length album Big Trouble that will be out somewhere next spring!" said de Caluwé of the album. "Listenable has been the home of many quality acts throughout the years and also marked the beginnings of Aborted so in a way it’s like coming home for that nice sundae to tickle your tonsils.

"Get ready for a massive onslaught of blasts and grooves to run you over like a bulldozer. The whole thing has been mixed and mastered by the mighty Dave Otero (Aborted, Archspire, Cattle Decapitation, Shadow of Intent) so you know it’s gonna be finger licking good! Alongside that we have a few other very neat surprises, so stay tuned for more!”
